importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from the Hamas attack on October 7, 2023, to the announcement of Hanegbi's dismissal in October 2025, reflects growing internal divisions and political tensions within Israel’s security leadership.

keyTakeAways: Tzachi Hanegbi, Israel's national security adviser, has been dismissed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, signaling a shift in national security strategy amid rising tensions over Gaza operations.
Hanegbi's departure follows weeks of speculation over disagreements with Netanyahu, particularly regarding military actions in Gaza and the handling of the October 7 attack.

Hanegbi publicly admitted responsibility for the failures that led to the October 7 Hamas attack and called for a thorough investigation, which has not yet been formally established by Netanyahu’s government.
Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, has been appointed as acting head of the NSC, indicating a move toward a more loyalist or pro-Netanyahu security leadership.
Opposition figures, including former army chief Gadi Eisenkot, criticized the firing as an evasion of responsibility and a replacement of critical voices with 'yes-men'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has dismissed National Security Adviser Tzachi Hanegbi, citing growing tensions over Gaza operations and the handling of the October 7 Hamas attack. Hanegbi, who had advocated for a partial deal with Hamas and opposed a full military takeover of Gaza City, admitted personal responsibility for the security failures and called for a thorough investigation, which Netanyahu’s government has not yet established. The move has drawn criticism from opposition figures like Gadi Eisenkot, who accused Netanyahu of replacing dissenting voices with loyalists. In response, Gil Reich, the deputy head of the National Security Council, has been appointed as acting head, signaling a shift toward a more centralized and compliant security apparatus.
title: Israel’s Netanyahu fires national security chief amid Gaza tensions
